entry.title: Tor hidden service support
entry.summary: In June 2012, Pieter Wuille wrote about exchanging and relaying addresses via the P2P network using the fd87:d87e:eb43::/48 IPv6 range. Andy Parkins suggested that bits from the addr.services be used to store an address family such as AF_INET, AF_INET6, AF_CUSTOM_TOR, and leave space for a few more which would only use four bits out of 64 mostly unused.
